node.title: Oil prices surge to their highest level since 2014
node.description: Energy costs are climbing over concerns the conflict in Eastern Europe could disrupt crude and natural gas supplies.

node.title: Crunch time for organisers to make call on running Fieldays 2022
node.description: The Mystery Creek event in June normally attracts over 100,000 people but with New Zealand currently in the red light Covid-19 setting, a decision to go ahead - or not - will be made within the next…

node.title: Bob Baffert sues Churchill Downs over 2-year suspension
node.description: The historic track suspended Baffert through 2023 and cited a recent spate of failed drug tests by his horses including now-deceased colt Medina Spirit​ after he won the Kentucky Derby.

node.title: COVID vaccine for kids less effective against Omicron, but booster helps
node.description: New data published from the CDC found booster shots appeared to restore protection.

node.title: RSE scheme cap increased to 16,000
node.description: The government has increased the cap on workers from the Pacific under the Recognised Seasonal Employer scheme to 16,000 workers.

node.title: Americans, Canadians answer Ukraine call for foreign fighters
node.description: A Texas software developer and a cook in British Columbia are among dozens of Americans and Canadians answering Ukraine's call for foreign volunteers to fight Russia's invasion.

node.title: Bloomfield misled public over testing capacity, says opposition
node.description: Dr Ashley Bloomfield's apology over testing delays is just the latest example of misleading the public, National says, and ACT's David Seymour wants the Director-General removed.

node.title: Cities hotter, less liveable - stark warning from climate report
node.description: Unliveable cities, more extreme weather and a loss of culture and health could be just around the corner, according to the latest international climate change report. Audio

node.title: Christopher Luxon calls for Russian ambassador to be expelled
node.description: The National Party leader says the time for diplomacy with regard to Russia's invasion of Ukraine is "well and truly over". Audio

node.title: Russia attack on Ukraine could drive up U.S. food prices
node.description: Reduced supplies of wheat and sunflower oil are likely to result in higher costs for American consumers.

node.title: Auckland Domain protest: Ngāti Whātua Ōrākei wants it brought to a swift end
node.description: Ngāti Whātua Ōrākei says it is disturbed by an occupation by protesters at the Auckland Domain, and wants it brought to a swift end.

node.title: DHBs go to court to try and stop health staff from striking
node.description: District health boards have gone to court to try to stop a planned strike by about 10,000 health workers on Friday.

node.title: Towering home to Russian diplomats in N.Y. has long been an enigma
node.description: The 20-story building is home to the families of diplomats serving in the Russian Mission to the United Nations — and maybe also a few spies.

node.title: Chef José Andrés makes emotional plea as he helps feed Ukrainian refugees
node.description: "We didn't learn enough from the horrors of the past," he said.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery jury foreman reveals trial moments that made him cry
node.description: Marcus Ransom was the only Black man on the jury that spent a week in a Brunswick, Georgia, courtroom hearing the hate crimes case.

node.title: What to watch for in Texas' primary elections
node.description: One House Democrat faces his toughest primary yet and the hardline GOP governor faces far-right challengers.

node.title: 'The birds just went nuts': Wild cherry trees find their sweet spot
node.description: Country Life: Black Siberian cherry trees are thriving on the river flats at Nigel Wilson's family farm in North Canterbury. Audio

node.title: Ship carrying thousands of luxury cars to U.S. sinks in Atlantic Ocean
node.description: A Portuguese Air Force helicopter evacuated the 22 crew members when the fire first broke out, setting the ship adrift.

node.title: Covid-19 hospitalisations to hit 800 in under a week at current rate
node.description: Data modeller Michael Plank says hospital numbers are doubling roughly every five days and if that continues, the number of people in hospital on 6 March could be close to 800.

node.title: IEA member nations agree to release 60 million barrels of oil
node.description: There will be "no shortfall in supplies" as a result of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the group said Tuesday.

node.title: Despite economic growth, families struggle to make ends meet
node.description: Even as President Biden touts his economic record, many people's finances are still far from recovery.

node.title: Omicron, worker exodus point to testing times ahead - economic reports
node.description: The Omicron outbreak and the loss of workers to Australia will test the economy, two reports suggest.

node.title: Millions of Americans could get tax refunds starting March 1
node.description: Taxpayers who claimed one of two tax credits are expected to get their refunds beginning this week, the IRS said.

node.title: Video shows men lined up and shot outside funeral service
node.description: Prosecutors say that they cannot confirm how many died, because the attackers cleaned up the scene and carted away any bodies.

node.title: RNZ wins at NZ TV Awards
node.description: RNZ series have won three awards at the NZ TV Awards tonight.

node.title: Tertiary union disappointed at university's handling of Covid-19
node.description: As Wellington's Victoria University faces a rapid spread of Covid-19 among students, the Tertiary Education Union says it is very disappointed in university leadership. Audio

node.title: Airbnb offers free housing for up to 100,000 Ukraine refugees
node.description: CEO Brian Chesky says more homes are needed in nearby countries to shelter those fleeing the war.

node.title: Proteas crush Black Caps in second test
node.description: South Africa turned the tables on the Black Caps with a 198-run victory in the second test in Christchurch, crushing the hosts' hopes of a breakthrough series win.

node.title: Gold Coast flood damage cost nears Cyclone Debbie figures
node.description: The flooding emergency continues in Australia with more than 1000 people rescued in northern New South Wales and an estimated 20,000 households affected by flooding in Queensland.

node.title: Former police chief arrested after allegedly faking his suicide
node.description: "He briefly attempted to flee into some nearby the woods before he was arrested," the Horry County Sheriff's Office said.
